channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gen Z’s expensive drug habit: More want brand-name meds that are 79% more expensive
item.description: Most Americans would prefer brand-name drugs—but end up buying generic versions because of the cost, new consumer research suggests.

item.title: Diplomats in Munich Fear Trump Is Giving Up Leverage to Putin Before Talks With Ukraine
item.description: Diplomats at the Munich Security Conference were uttering “appeasement,” with all its historical resonance, to describe the Trump administration’s app...

item.title: Vance Tells Europeans to Stop Shunning Parties Deemed Extreme
item.description: His comments shocked attendees at the Munich Security Conference and seemed to target efforts to sideline the hard-right party the Alternative for Ger...

item.title: Layoffs Expand at Federal Agencies, Part of Trump Purge
item.description: Mass firings have rocked multiple agencies as President Trump and Elon Musk ramp up plans to drastically slash and reshape the federal work force.

item.title: Dismissed nuclear bomb specialists recalled by Energy Department
item.description: Between 300 and 400 workers at the National Nuclear Safety Administration were terminated.

item.title: Buffett sold more BofA stock while keeping Apple stake intact
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway cut its stake in the bank to 8.9% in the fourth quarter after selling 117.5 million shares.

item.title: From legal settlements to business ventures, mega corporations are making deals with President Donald Trump and the Trump family
item.description: Companies have reportedly doled out $80 million to the Trump family and his presidential library, according to the Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Judge Lets Musk’s Team Keep Access to Records at Some Agencies, for Now

item.title: Judges Generally Let Prosecutors Drop Charges. Maybe Not for Adams.
item.description: Judge Dale E. Ho will weigh the request after the resignation of Manhattan’s U.S. attorney and her accusations of misconduct.

item.title: Map: 6.0-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Ethiopia
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Are ‘healthy’ sodas actually good for you? What benefits Olipop and Poppi actually have
item.description: What to know about the trendy sodas that tout gut-health benefits.
